content.prompt: Which of the following explains the difference between the policies that Nigeria and Russia have adopted in response to global economic forces?

choices.label: Russia has established a policy of promoting foreign direct investment, while Nigeria has opposed such investment and focused on domestic production.
Russia has joined the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and Nigeria has refused to join any international organizations.
Russia has established special zones for foreign investment but maintained a communist system, while Nigeria has relied on a state-owned oil company for government revenue.
Russia has re-nationalized the oil and gas industries, while Nigeria has opened up to foreign domestic investment to extract its abundant oil resources.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

topic.text: 5.2: Political Responses to Global Market Forces

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
